Name: Animo: Cross Trainers – Stagnetic Strategy Deck
Description:
Stand Firm! The Stagnetic Strategy Deck features everything you need to start playing Animo! Use this deck to play the game mode "Hide it in Your Heart" with up to 5 players- OR- use this deck as a stand alone to challenge up to 3 other players (each with their own decks) in the more strategic game, "Sharpen Your Sword". This deck contains 54 collectible game cards from the latest Cross Trainers expansion. Also included is a deck box, score tracker, power tokens, a Stagnetic themed poster playmat, full game instructions, and a shiny holographic Stagnetic Ultra card!

—description from the publisher

Name: YES or NO: The Game
Description:
Bring the show home! With 200 cards and the ability to play up to 9 people at once, it's easy to see why this is the best-selling and most important game at the Daily Wire (according to Michael Knowles)!
Put your knowledge of your friends and family to the test and ponder our time's most titillating topics with YES or NO!

Name: AntaYagí
Description:
Welcome to the city of a thousand hats! Where you have the same possibilities of winning great fortunes as of ruining yourself in the attempt... 
You don't need to look out of the window of your carriage to know that you have arrived at your destination.
The bustle of the market and the smell of money is more than enough. You take a quick glance at your saddlebags, where a tail of smelly fish peeks over the edge, and you smile triumphantly, this is yours.  
In AntaYagi, 3 to 7 players will become ambitious merchants seeking fame and fortune, although in the end only the best bartering master will achieve glory.  
What are you waiting for, make the most... peculiar trades, and sabotage your competitors to become a true merchant?
The one who gets the most goods will be the winner!

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: British Royals Murder Mystery
Description:
Tonight will be a night of shock, scandal, death and deceit- so just another day in the life of the British monarchy.

Transport your guests to the palace as you host your very own murder mystery.  Will you unmask the killer and be knighted, or will you fail and end up banished from the kingdom forever?

The box contains:
Host instructions
12 character biography cards
12 reaction cards
12 round 1 clue cards
12 crime scene props
10 MIS report cards
1 accusation notepad
1 notepad
Solution cards
Awards for best and worst actors

Name: Mage Noir: Way of the Warrior-Mage
Description: Mage Noir: Way of the Warrior-Mage contains 54 mineral cards to add to Mage Noir.

Name: Mage Noir: Way of the Time Bender
Description: Mage Noir: Way of the Time Bender contains 54 arcane cards for use with Mage Noir.

Name: The Castle of Sanguine Blight
Description:
The Castle of Sanguine Blight is a fast, simple, dark, solo-adventure, dungeon card game. It is created as a love letter to the Castlevania and Shadowgate videogames, Cthulhu by Gaslight RPG, and classic Gothic horror.

Choose between 4 doomed characters, and face 30 eerie rooms and 30 blood-dripping events. Acquire 12 weird items that may help you on the way to defeat the vampire and its 9 horrible attacks.

Replay and experience a different castle the next time. Or why not use the cards as inspiration when you need a fateful turn of events for your regular RPG session.

To play the game, you need a couple of six-sided dice, plenty of luck, and the courage to withstand the fear.

Name: Necromunda: Book of the Outlands
Description:
Necromunda: Book of the OUtlands continues to expand on the game, introducing a wealth of new rules to add even more variety, scope and excitment to your battles on Necomunda.

Inside the book you will find:

Ash Waste Nomads and Ironhead Squat Prospectors Gangs.  This includes rules for creating and running gangs of the mysterious Ash Waste Nomads and Iron Squat Prospectors.  Included are profiles for the fighters of both gangs, such as the mystic Stormcallers of the Ash Waste Nomads capable of controlling Necromunda's storms while riding into battle on Dustback Helamites.

It also has rules for assembling a gang that calls the wastes their home, including mounting your gangers on bikes and hiring crew to man your vehicles such as an Orlock Iron Rider, Scum Race or Guild of Coin Hauler.

Finally it has a comprehensive ruleset to allow to create your own vehicles to traverse the wastes in and assert your gang's dominance.  It has full vehicle rules.

Name: Baulöwe
Description: The players are managers of construction companies and have to fulfill three contracts: to build a subway station, a hotel (with a partner) and a shopping center. They take turns to roll one or two dice and move their pawns around the game board. On some spaces the players draw different kinds of cards with business transactions, on other spaces events directly hinder or benefit the players. When all three contracts are fulfilled, the player changes to the inner track for marketing, human resources and planning to develop their business and take out their competitors upon reaching the "Baulöwe" space. When all players have arrived on the "Baulöwe" space or have been taken out, the remaining player with the highest profit wins the game.

Name: Supersystem: Showdown!
Description:
Showdown is an exciting supplement for SuperSystem that includes Quick-Start Rules for new players to give the game a try, new maneuvers, a complete power list including new and revised powers, four new scenarios, over twenty new characters to add to your SuperSystem games, and conversion notes to use them in the HERO System and M & M Superlink.  Grab your SuperFigs and start saving the world today.

Includes: a set of quick-start rules, new and revised rules, new and revised powers, additional scenarios, and new Four-Color universe characters with stats for two popular Superhero RPGs.

Name: Yay, May-or, Nay
Description:
The goal of Yay, May-or, Nay is to work with your team to make it to the Mayor's office. You do this by answering questions anywhere from logic puzzles to open-ended opinion questions to move across the board. These questions are scenarios you may encounter as mayor or problems that could happen in a city. One player takes on the role of "Council Master" and judge the answers of the two teams deciding whether they can move on or repeat the question. The Council Master will have two biases from the bias deck that inform their opinion about proposed answers.

This game encourages players to think through logical arguments and their reasoning behind their answers. No matter how good the end solution is, if a player does not support it with a logical argument, they will fail that question. This games also encourages teamwork as the players except for the Council Master are split into two separate teams who must work together.

The end goal of this game is to be able to use it in the classroom to teach logic, argument skills, teamwork, and engage students. It was created with a math classroom (specifically geometry) but it can be used in any classroom, especially government classes.

—description from the designer

Name: Pop Chumps: Drag Edition 2
Description:
Pop Chumps: Drag Edition 2 is a card game that allows you and your fishy friends to battle it out with some of your favourite queens from RuPaul's Drag Race.

Each Ru-Girl has been illustrated in their most iconic moments with categories such as Runway Rating and Lip-sync Level, the game puts you straight into the workroom to see if you can become America's Next Drag Superstar.

Drag Edition 2 can be played as a standalone game, or combined with Edition 1 for even more queens! Drag Edition 2 introduces Alaska, Chad Michaels, Sasha Velour, Violet Chachki, Courtney Act, Trixie Mattel, Willam, Peppermint, Jasmine Masters, Katya, Gia Gunn, Jinkx Monsoon and many more to the game.

Name: Pop Chumps: Drag Edition
Description:
Pop Chumps: Drag Edition is a card game that allows you and your fishy friends to battle it out with some of your favourite queens from RuPaul's Drag Race.

Each Ru-Girl has been illustrated in their most iconic moments with categories such as Runway Rating and Lip-sync Level, the game puts you straight into the workroom to see if you can become America's Next Drag Superstar.

Volume one features fan favourites including Shangela, Adore Delano, Bianca Del Rio, Laganja Estranja, Sharon Needles, Valentina, Bob The Drag Queen, Jujubee, Tatianna, Latrice Royale, and the iconic Stacy Layne Matthews.

Drag Edition can be played as a standalone game, or combined with Drag Edition 2 for even more queens!

Name: Disney Kingdomania: Super Game Pack
Description:
Disney Kingdomania takes place inside a make-believe, 8-bit video game that's experiencing glitches that are mixing up the levels. Players must patch the glitches before it's "Game Over" for the characters and their digital game world.

Disney Kingdomania: Super Game Pack contains 20 level tiles, a maleficent dragon, three characters from a set of 18 (including Buzz Lightyear, Mickey Mouse, Stitch and Princess Tiana), and two items from a set of 12, such as Aladdin's Magic Carpet and Maleficent's Spinning Wheel. You can play a game solely with these components, or you can combine these components with those in other Super Game Packs or one or more Disney Kingdomania: Game Balls.

Name: Disney Kingdomania: Game Ball
Description:
Disney Kingdomania takes place inside a make-believe, 8-bit video game that's experiencing glitches that are mixing up the levels. Players must patch the glitches before it's "Game Over" for the characters and their digital game world.

Disney Kingdomania: Game Ball contains 12 level tiles and two characters from a set of 26, including Buzz Lightyear, Mickey Mouse, Stitch, Princess Tiana, and rare "glitched" character figures. You can play a game solely with these components, or you can combine these components with those in other Game Balls or one or more Disney Kingdomania: Super Game Packs.

Name: Outlines
Description:
Outlines is an extraordinary drawing game. Everything is about the countours. Using the drawing stick you try to form the shape with a necklace. Who reognizes the outline of the pinapple first? Who will get the most points?

—description from the publisher

Name: Quiziko
Description:
Completely clueless? Superficial knowledge? Or smartypants? Everybody can participate in this game!
Those who dare to answer early may rake in big points - or risk coming away empty-handed, while everyone else pulls ahead. Because one by one the wrong answers will disappear and, thereby, the chance to guess correctly rises.

—description from the publisher

Name: Distress Call: A Game of Cubes and Corporate Reacquisition
Description:
Congratulations on successfully completing the hiring process for the Corporate Reacquisitions Department. As a newly inducted permanent employee of CORECorp, you will soon have the privilege of answering Distress Calls, urgent summons for aid from fellow employees, where you will proceed to secure all of their issued company property and return it safely to the nearest Processing Facility. Distressed employees are not eligible for rescue or relief at this time.

In Distress Call, players will assume the roles of crew members aboard a Corporate Reacquisitions ship, specialists who have been tasked with securing specific types of cargo. Taking turns, following the lead of the Employee of the Moment, players will divide up company assets, choosing pallets of randomly sorted cargo.

Once all the cargo has been seized, each crew member will deposit their pallet's cargo into a locked storage container. The three shared storage containers are only opened at the end of the game, so each crew member will have to remember where they stored cargo as well as what type of cargo other crew members stored.

After answering three Distress Calls, sorting and securing cargo each time, the ship will set its autopilot for the nearest Processing Facility where the containers with the least Space Trash are deposited and their contents scored. Make more points than the other crew members by ensuring the return of your specialized cargo to win the game!

-description from designer

Name: Aventuras del Oeste: Los Indios Atacan
Description:
Using the cards, players will free their four tokens, located in each of the four sections: INDIANS, CAVALRY, , COWBOYS and CARAVAN, making sure that no other player catches them. The first player to do so wins the game.
—description from the box (translated)

Por medio de las tarjetas, cada jugador habrá de liberar a sus cuatro fichas situadas en cada uno de los cuatro apartados: INDIOS, CABALLERÍA, VAQUEROS y CARAVANA, procurando al mismo tiempo, que ninguno de los otros jugadores le atrape. Gana la partida el que lo consigue en primer lugar.
—description from the box

Name: Moku Tower: The Endless Column
Description:
Moku Tower: The Endless Column is a new edition from the original Moku Tower. Moku Tower: The Endless Column inherits the tradition of Moku Tower collection. It embraces the concept of Japanese home decoration and transforms wood art into an artistic and interactive tabletop game. This new version is inspired by both Romanian and Japanese Culture. While the Woodas rock are inspired by the traditional Japanese rock garden, the Endless Column are inspired by the Romanian infinite column. By combining both the rock and the column together, it has become a masterpiece featuring the beauty of both the East and West.

The game combines balance, patience, reaction and a bit of luck together. It is a wonderful tabletop game and, at the same time, a beautiful decoration for your home. Look at the amazing art work: Do you feel like being in Japan?

For The Endless Column, building a tall tower is not enough. You need a solid one! And as always, beware of incoming attacks! I mean real physical attack! Are you ready to get your Endless Column and build your own endless tower now? Let’s go!

Regarding the general gameplay, in each round there will be 3 active players with different roles: Dark Stacker, Pale Stacker and Invader. The Stackers need to compete to be the FIRST to COMPLETE the mission they got from the card(s) in order to score marks. At the same time, the Invader will roll the dice and attack the Stackers based on what they get on the dice. There will be some fun physical movement like firing the dice to attack the tower! Each player take turn to compete and the game goes on until the first player scores 20 marks.

-description from designer

Name: Escape Box: Dinosaurier
Description: The famous geologist Professor Flynn has disappeared on his last expedition. As his assistants, you enter a strange underground jungle kingdom populated by dinosaurs. A large volcano is about to erupt and threatens to destroy the newly discovered world. Players have 45 minutes to solve all the puzzles and find the professor.

Name: Aviones y Dragones
Description:
The fearsome Dragons are coming to destroy our world!

Become the hero of humanity. Maneuver at high speed, aim and fire the rockets while controlling the ship's resources, show your skill and defeat the most beasts to achieve victory.

The goal of the game is to get the highest score to get the best combat nickname.

Depending on the roll of both dice, all the pilots will perform a maneuver on their sheet tracing a path in order to aim and fire the missiles at the fearsome dragons, avoiding being damaged by them.

At the same time they must manage the ship's resources, on several occasions returning to bases to recharge.

Each pilot's game ends when he returns to any base for the fourth time or his ship is destroyed.

Game modes

     Solo
     Competitive up to 50 players
     Cooperative 2 players
     4 player hardcore co-op

Name: Ruins of Lamur
Description:
You are a world famous adventurer and explorer. The entrance to the buried ruins of the ancient city of Lamur have been discovered, and you’ve rushed to put together an expedition. After long weeks of travel, you crest a mountain pass at the head of your caravan, and look down on the lost valley. As you near the ruins, other groups approach from other directions, and who should be leading them but your greatest rivals! None of you are the type to share glory, so one of you suggests a wager: whoever manages to leave the city with the greatest collection of discoveries will take everything, including all the fame!

You start the game by placing the entrance tile. Each player chooses a Player Piece and places it on the Entrance. Each player gets 5 Discovery cards to start the game, which represent the equipment & supplies you bring with you into the ruin. On each turn, a player can:
– Explore by placing a new Tile card next to the Tile they’re on. If the Tile is a room with a number, you place that number of Discovery cards face-up on the Tile to represent the things occupying the room.
– Move by discarding a card from their hand. You can move a number of tiles up to the value of the discarded card. You then draw a card to represent discoveries you made along the way. Every player should always have 5 cards in their hand.
– Claim the top card from the pile on the Tile they’re on (if there are any). In order to do this, you need to discard a card from your hand that is worth the same or more than the card being claimed. Each type of card is worth double against one other type, and half against another.

The objective is to have the highest-scoring hand when the game ends. The basic scoring system, and a few optional variants, are laid-out in the rules included with the game, but house rules are encouraged! The game ends when the last card is drawn from the Discovery card deck. It’s also possible for a player to deliberately end the game if no more Tiles can be placed, and they can get to the Entrance tile.

-description from the designer

Name: Hoa-Binh 1951-1952: The Battle of the Black River
Description:
On 22 September 1951, the Viet Minh 312th Division crossed the Red River and attacked a Franco-Vietnamese garrison along the crest line of Nghia Lo, 140 km from Hanoï, on the Thai highlands between the Red River and the Black River. This action made it clear that Giap’s objective was to control the Tonkin delta in order to threaten Hanoï from the south. De Lattre decided to block him by launching a vast operation against his supply lines by occupying the Muong country in the Hoa Binh and Cho Ben sectors between the Da River and the Black River. After seizing Cho Ben (Operation Tulip), the French launched Operation Lotus to seize Hoa Binh.

Hoa Binh, the Battle of the Black River is a solo-player game simulating the combats around the Black River and Colonial Route #6 that occurred from 13 November 1951 to 25 February 1952. The counters mainly represent the French battalions or Viet Minh actions and one game turn represents ten days of operation. The map represents the region of the confluence of the Red River and the Black River in Tonkin, specifically from Viet Tri in the north to Hoa Binh in the south and the immediate surroundings of the Muong territories.

VaeVictis #163
Duration: Approximately 3 hours 
Complexity: 5/10

Solitaire game.

[English rules are available for download from the VaeVictismag.fr webpage.]

Name: Houdini's Secret Room
Description:
The 150-year-old house that belonged to the most famous illusionist Houdini is now a museum. You decide to go there and learn some of his greatest tricks and illusions. Walking around, your curiosity leads you to a secret room, one in which no one has set foot for over a century. As you enter the room, the door slams shut, leaving you locked inside while the walls start closing in slowly.

On the table is Houdini’s testimony, which says:
“You are the chosen one who managed to enter this secret room. Whoever finds a way to break out of it will have the privilege of becoming my heir.”

The key, which unlocks the door, is hidden somewhere in the room. However, in order to find it, you must solve some challenges first. Houdini left you a pencil, glue and scissors, along with six different cards, which will help you solve the challenges ahead. If you want to get out of this room, you need to get inside the mind of the greatest illusionist and start thinking like him.

Can you escape and become the next Houdini?

You have 60 minutes before the walls crush you, so you better hurry up—the clock is ticking!


This amazing game is designed to help all creative people throwing a next-level experience for their loved ones. We created a thrilling story with beautifully designed puzzles that brings the escape room excitement right into your living room.Players will enjoy in:
- Crafting 3D figures, cutting, gluing, and folding paper.
- Experience mind-reading tricks and see for themselves how powerful some mind-reading techniques can be.
- Getting out of mazes.
- Six distinct characters.
- Hints with rhymes and exceptional art design.

Escape Room is more than just solving puzzles — it is all about the whole experience. To help you transform your space into an engrossing, captivating escape room, our game kit includes more than just the puzzles. In your download, you’ll also find posters and invitations that heighten the immersive power of Houdini’s Secret Room and bring the mystery much closer to you.

Name: Mean Robo
Description:
Mean Robo is a competitive strategy card game for 2 to 4 players. In a round, players take turns placing Robos on the game area to target the other player’s team. Card placement determines who will blow up in the attack phase. Collect any Robos you blow up, and the player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: RayRacers
Description:
RayRacers is a fast-paced spatial strategy and survival game for 2-4 players. Players simultaneously place their cards on a game grid to create ray-lines, move across the grid, and make obstacles for their opponents to crash into. The last surviving player wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel Dice Throne: Promo Card Set
Description:
25 new cards for use in Marvel Dice Throne.

Includes:
 8 x Main Phase Cards
8 x Randomizer Cards
8 x Mythic Cards
1 x How To Use Card

Name: Trojan War
Description:
In Trojan War the players are divided into Greeks and Trojans where they try cooperatively but at the same time and individually to be crowned the winners of the game, conquering as many victory points as possible both for themselves and overall for their team. In the game players use legendary heroes such as Achilles, Hector, military units such as Myrmidons, Dardanes, figures such as Helen of Troy, Cassandra, structures such as the Walls of Troy, the Trojan Horse, all under the watchful eye and the moods of the Gods of Olympus!

The game lasts 6 rounds, in each round players try to earn victory points by doing actions such as technology, exploration, supply, sacrificing for the favor of the gods, visiting the oracle and duel. Each round ends with a duel between 2 legendary heroes. 
Winer is the player with the most victory points at the end of the game. 
Winning team is the team whose players have collected the most victory points at the end of the game !!!

Name: Animo: Cross Trainers – Draylight Strategy Deck
Description: Dive Deeper! The Draylight Strategy Deck features everything you need to start playing Animo! Use this deck to play the game mode "Hide it in Your Heart" with up to 5 players- OR- use this deck to challenge up to 3 other players (each with their own decks) in the strategic game mode, "Sharpen Your Sword". This deck contains 54 collectible game cards from the latest Cross Trainers expansion. Also included is a deck box, score tracker, power tokens, a Draylight themed poster playmat, full game instructions, and a shiny, holographic Draylight Ultra card!

Name: Prophets of Doom
Description:
The end of the world is coming - but do you know exactly how it will happen?

In Prophets of Doom, players will take on the roles of Doomsday Cult founders. Each cult has their own unique powers to use as they build their compounds, recruit followers, and try to avoid unwanted attention.

On each turn, players will draft cards that they can use to:


     Build an addition to their compound.
     Discard to invoke one of their abilities.


A cult's abilities are used to collect resources, attract followers, complete projects, build vaults, and recruit officers to help prepare for doomsday.

After every round of play, players can use the locations they have built within their compound for their unique and powerful rewards.

As the game progresses, players will be able to gain "foresight" into the end of the world. If they get enough of this resource, they can take a peek at the impending apocalypse and develop a better idea of how to plan for the end of everything.

After the final round, players can use the resources they have collected to strengthen their defenses one last time. Whoever does the best job keeping their compound and followers safe will be the winner and will lead the remains of humanity as the ashes fall.

—description from publisher

Name: Nabla Operator Game
Description:
This game is an exciting math battle game. The goal of this game is to make the opponents zero-dimensional. You use cards with various operators and functions for the goal.

At the beginning of the game, each player has 3 "bases "(1, X, X ^ 2). In your turn, you can perform an operation or add a function to their field from their hands. You can choose between attack or defense.

When you choose Attack: Differentiate the opponent's base and erase it.
When you choose Defense: Add your own base or strengthen it with integration.

The base disappears when the result of the operation becomes 0 or diverges.

It seems difficult, but once you learn how to play it, you can always play this exciting game.

Name: Saropoly
Description:
Saropoly is a satirical board game about the music industry published by British independent record label Sarah Records as their fiftieth 'single'. It was packaged as a 7" single but contained a fold-out board and a wooden die.

Players take on the roles of four contemporary record label bosses - Alan McGee (Creation), Tony Wilson (Factory), Richard Branson (Virgin) and Ivo Watts-Russell (4AD) - who must travel around the city of Bristol, south-west England, to collect the eight essential ingredients required to publish a Sarah Records EP, with the first player to do so and successfully return to the Sarah Records head office being the winner.

Name: DUO: Was passt?
Description:
Learning German easily and playfully? This is now possible with the pairs of cards from "DUO - What fits?". Players have to concentrate, memorize words and react quickly - but luck also plays a role with surprise cards.

The ideal fun game for all German learners, young and old, from level A2.

The game contains 2 decks of 100 cards each. In the three variants of the game, trick-taking, placement and memory, the aim is to identify and collect matching pairs of cards. Jokers, different point values â€‹â€‹and the hourglass bring additional dynamics into play. The player who has the highest number of points with the cards collected at the end wins.


     The entertaining card game for learning German with three exciting game variants.
     Versatile language learning effect thanks to 9 content categories: opposites, colors, parts of speech, image-text pairs, compound words, comparisons, regional terms, idioms, synonyms
     Language skills, luck, concentration and some tactics lead to success


The game materials:

     Game instructions with three game variants
     200 playing cards
     Hourglass (15 sec)


—description from publisher (translated)

Name: Animo: Red Letter Day – Percy Strategy Deck
Description: The Percy 54 Card Strategy Deck is packed with everything you need to start playing! This Hope/Faith themed deck is built around beloved character, "Percy" and features Percy themed deck box, punch tokens, scoring trackers and poster playmat accordingly. This deck also includes an exclusive Percy Lv. 2 foil card and a Percy miniature figure for tracking your defeated Sinnies! This deck is pre-structured for 1 player to play Sharpen Your Sword (each player needs their own deck)- it plays great on it's own, but can also be customized by swapping and trading cards from other decks or packs. Red Letter Day cards are cross compatible with other Animo expansions!

Name: BrainBox: Tierkinder
Description:
Each card shows pictures from chicks to caterpillars to puppies, calves, foals and fawns. On the back of each card are six questions about the animals on the front.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die.  If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes (or the deck is completed) is the winner.

Name: Food Chain Island: Expansion Collection
Description:
A compilation of previously released expansions for Food Chain Island:


     Food Chain Island: Friendly Waters
     Food Chain Island: Tough Skies
     Food Chain Island: Lost Beasts
     Food Chain Island: Legendary Creatures

Name: Ugly Gryphon Inn: Expansion Collection
Description:
A compilation of previously released expansions for Ugly Gryphon Inn:


     Ugly Gryphon Inn: More Patrons
     Ugly Gryphon Inn: Local Dragons
     Ugly Gryphon Inn: Innployees
     Ugly Gryphon Inn: The Little Beak Guesthouse

Name: Unsurmountable: Expansion Collection
Description:
A compilation of 4 expansions for Unsurmountable:


     Unsurmountable: Big Climb
     Unsurmountable: Dual Peaks
     Unsurmountable: Acclimatization
     Unsurmountable: Rescue Mission

Name: Forbidden Psalm: Rotten Bits
Description:
From the bleak corners of the world comes forth a collaboration of the darkest kind: Westfalia Miniatures and KRD Designs bring you a new way to experience the Forbidden Psalm. Based on the MÖRK BORG MINIATURES range by Westfalia, Rotten Bits provides you with:


     a new mini campaign for Forbidden Psalm
     new warband options and mercenaries
     new monsters


—description from the publisher

Name: Forbidden Psalm: Forbidden Wilderness
Description:
From the tales of old, and beasts of a time forgotten, comes forth a collaboration of the deadliest kind: Geektopia Games, creators of the Fearsome Wilderness board game, and KRD Designs, the mind behind Forbidden Psalm, team up to bring you new horrors for Forbidden Psalm! Featuring creatures based on the Fearsome Wilderness miniatures range and board game, Forbidden Wilderness features classic cryptids from American folklore, stated up and ready to roll, including:


     the Dingmaul
     the Dungavenhooter
     the Jackalope
     the Jersey Devil
     the Wampus Cat
     and 19 more!

Name: Big Conspiracy Card Game
Description:
Big Conspiracy Card Game is an original strategic party game that will keep both conspiracy theorists and skeptics laughing. Players play as conspiracy theorists investigating a "Big Conspiracy." During a game, players cite ridiculous evidence and make absurd arguments in order to make wild accusations that support their unique biases.

Big Conspiracy Card Game is a satirical trip down the rabbit hole. The game consists of 175 unique cards full of original art, jokes, conspiracy theory lore, and tons of Easter eggs.

—description from the designer

Name: HeroQuest: The Frozen Horror
Description:
The frozen horror has burst forth from the icy tomb where it rested these last centuries, recovering its strength and awaiting Zargon's summons. At last, that call has come, and the raging beast has returned to its ancient seat of power deep within the ice mountain. As we speak, it is rallying its minions and mobilizing its plans to cover the Northlands and the Realm in a shroud of deadly ice. Barbarian, you must call on courage and skill you did not realize you had to confront the evil of the frozen horror!

In HeroQuest: The Frozen Horror, an expansion for the HeroQuest Game System, you must journey through the bleak and frigid Northlands to destroy the evil frozen horror, a ferocious creature long banished. As the powerful barbarian, you are first challenged to survive dangerous solo quests to prove your strength and valor. Only then will your fellow heroes join you to gain access to the ice mountain to destroy the Scepter of Glacial Majesty and defeat the terrible monster.

Name: Grandpa's Great Escape Board Game
Description:
The World of David Walliams brings you The Twilight Towers Amazing Break-out Board Game! This beautifully designed 3D game brings to life the best-selling book by David Walliams. Is it the end of days for Jack’s rather confused grandpa or can you help him ESCAPE the evil clutches of the Twilight Towers! It’s a race to save the old folk from the evil clutches of Miss Swine, the hideous matron that will happily zip you with her cattle prod! Climb the overhanging willow tree, take a wide berth to miss the ‘not so lovely’ nurses, then take to the skies aboard a World War Two RAF Spitfire whilst being chased down by the deadly German Messerschmitt! Be the first player to bring home Jack and the old folk in this fast, exciting cat-and-mouse style game for two to four players, based on the best-selling book from David Walliams. This fantastic, easy play, 3D family board game and is perfect for 2-4 players age 7 years and over.

—description from the publisher

Name: Homunculus
Description:
You and your fellow players are a Wizard's minions, imps spawned out of a vat.  While your Master is away adventuring, you have free run of his workshop.  Experiment with his magical adjuncts to serve your Master better than your fellow minions, and you will be well-rewarded when the Wizard returns.  Or you COULD just get rid of your competition by doing away with your vat-mates altogether!

Homunculus was first published in The Game Crafter Community Anthology, and is a small game created with a constrained set of components from that anthology.

In phase 1 of each round, each player takes turns rolling 8 dice, and using them to activate 1-3 activities in the Wizard's Workshop, each providing some number of element cubes. When all players have gained cubes, phase 2 begins, and players simultaneously take Actions to move up the Favor Track, or to attack each other!

To win, you must either destroy all your fellow vatmates, or have the most Favor (and at least 4 Favor) when the Wizard returns after 6 rounds.

Homunculus is a fast and cutthroat game of vicious minions!

—description from the publisher

Name: Der 6. Tag
Description:
Cheat evolution. Breed new creatures from elephants, tigers and the like by mating. Funny combinations arise, such as the crophant or the turtdile.

But watch out for the rabbit! His mating behavior can mess up your planning a bit...

The 6th Day by Axel Hennig is a solo game for ages 8 and up.

Help nature a little bit. Pair two animals with each other and marvel at the result. Your goal is to have the most valuable collection of animals after four generations.

Shuffle all 18 numbered cards except the rabbit and place the first green, blue and yellow card from the top of the pile in the center of the table.
As a deck, you then take the remaining 15 cards in your hand. The red end-of-round card goes behind the deck.
If you play the rabbit variant, the rabbit goes behind the end-of-round card.

Each turn, you look at the top three cards of your deck. 
After that, you have two choices: The evolution pause or the mating.
If you can't or don't want to mate any animals, you put one of the three cards to the right of the three cards in the evolution pause and then you take one of the three cards and put it behind your deck.

To mate, use the mating options shown on the cards. 
Directional arrows also show you action requests for pairing. You turn one of the two cards involved either around its center axis or its long side and then put it behind the deck as usual.

If you see an exclamation mark next to the direction arrow, put the card aside. If you do, you won't be able to develop it, but it will earn you points in the end.

The other card used for pairing is placed in the center of the table. Then take a new card from the three already there and put it behind your deck.

As soon as the red end-of-round card is the top card in the deck, turn it according to its directional arrow and put it back behind your deck.
After the fourth round, total up your points by adding up the values of all the cards (from the center of the table, your deck, and the cards already set aside), taking into account any bonuses you have unlocked.

For example, if you have upgraded both Chameleons twice, you get nine points instead of six.

VARIANT WITH RABBITS

Once you have familiarized yourself with the game, you can use the rabbit.
Play two rounds, one without rabbit and one with rabbit using the same card order in your deck. Before starting the first round, write down the order of the card numbers to be able to create an equal deck for the second round.
Try to avoid a mating rabbit as this costs you victory points.
Your goal is to score more points in the round with the rabbit.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Monopoly: Star Wars – Boba Fett
Description: Celebrate the legendary Bounty Hunter and the galaxy of characters he has encountered, with this Monopoly: Star Wars Boba Fett edition board game. Star Wars fans will love the gameboard spaces that depict iconic Star Wars characters, and the cardboard Boba Fett tokens showing him in a classic pose or one of his more recent looks. Add symbols from Boba Fett's armor to properties. When a player gets a color set they can start adding Sigils to their characters and then upgrade to Skulls. Players move around the board collecting characters, equipment, and Imperial Forces, and relive favorite Boba Fett moments from Episodes V and VI of the Star Wars movies, as well as action-packed scenes from The Mandalorian TV series.

Name: Räuber und Gendarm / Schwarzer Mann
Description:
Räuber u. Gendarm
Each player has 8 tokens. The robber player places his tokens on the 8 gray spaces. The gendarme player starts from the red spaces. Movement is one space per turn or one or more jumps over friendly or opposite tokens. Opposite tokens are turned over to change sides and may be placed on any free space.
The game ends if one player has no more tokens or if one player can't move anymore. The player with the most tokens left wins the game.

Schwarzer Mann
The black man player gets 2 tokens and places them on gray spaces. The children player places his 14 tokens on the red spaces on one side of the board. The children may move only, the black men may move or jump. If a black man jumps over a child, it's token is turned over and transforms into a black man. The game ends, if 7 of them reach the red spaces on the black men's side of the board or if the black men transform all children. It also ends, if the black men block the remaining children so that theay arent able to reach their destination spaces. After two games with changed roles the player who has moved the most cildren to their destinations wins the game.

Name: Lidera tu Tribu
Description:
Lidera tu Tribu is a fast and dynamic strategy game that invites you to have a good time with friends, family or even break the ice with strangers!

Each player must lead a match of 3 rounds. In each round, the leader must define a goal and those who meet it add points.

The advantage? If all Tribe members meet the target, the leader gets twice as many points as the rest. Can you make your Tribe follow you?

The game is a deck of 100 cards that allows you to take it everywhere, it is not necessary to use a table or board.

—description from the publisher

Name: QUINS
Description:
Objective: Complete the word QUINS to win.

Preparation: Deal 5 cards to each player. 
Start: The youngest player will start the game.

Function: In each turn the player will roll the dice to perform the different actions.

Actions: Reveal Card, Change Card, Steal Card, Place Bomb, Explode Card, Lose Turn, Protect Card and Change Game.

—description from the designer

Name: Nooblings
Description:
The King is in search of a new Champion of the realm!

Take on the role of challengers vying for the title of Champion and defeat the other players to prove you are worthy!

Players must select a class, each with their own unique abilities. The classes are:
- Knight (take less damage)
- Ranger (escape more easily)
- Wizard (spells pack an extra punch)
- Merchant (save money on items)
- Cleric (restore health over time)
- Assassin (deal more damage)
- Noble (get an extra item when you land on the castle)

You will take turns rolling and traveling around the board, landing on different space types (note: if you land on another player you may attack them). The rulebook has a standard setup shown, but is customizable so that you can add, reduce, and mix up spaces for variety and replay-ability. The space types are:
- Monster (fight an NPC)
- Random Event (something happens)
- Shop (buy or attempt to steal items)
- Tavern (restore health)
- Castle (start here; get a gift from the King when you pass)
- Arena (battle another player as if you just landed on them)
- Bandit (pay to steal from another player)

The objective of the game is to defeat the other players in combat and earn points, with the first to reach the predetermined number declared the winner, or play last-man-standing in which the last player surviving is the winner and crowned Champion. Players may choose to team up if they wish, but can always end their truce at any time without notice.

When you land on another player you will have the option to attack and engage them in battle. In battle, you will take turns either rolling to attack or rolling in an attempt to flee, and may strategically utilize a wide variety of items and spells to gain the upper hand. Battle only ends when one player is defeated (their health drops to 0), or when someone rolls for a successful escape.

Items are purchased (or stolen) from the Shop. These include a huge variety of weapons, spells, trinkets, gear, consumables, and more. You don't have to show what items you have in your inventory unless it is actively equipped (like a weapon), so you never know what your opponent may have in store should you attack them and vice versa; Could be some paltry Moldy Boots and a Vegetable Stew, or an epic spell like Meteor Strike and a healing potion or two. Card-play is an integral part of Nooblings, and knowing when to play a certain card could mean the difference between victory or defeat.

On your quest to become champion, you will encounter a variety of dangerous monsters and may choose to either stand your ground and fight or attempt to run away. If you successfully defeat a monster you will receive loot (gold coins) which can be spent to purchase items, rest at the Tavern, and more.

Random Event cards are drawn and flipped over when you land on a Random Event space. Something will immediately happen. These could be good or bad, can affect one or multiple players, and sometimes you might have to make an important choice which could change the tide of the game.

Name: Le grand marais
Description:
A tile laying game set in 1003 in Maillezais abbey (West of France), sold in the marais poitevin local tourist shops.

You have 3 tiles in hand and on your turn you must lay one, each type of tiles has a different scoring system. The game proposes various scenarios (set up and scorings) that tell the story of the Marais poitevin.

Name: Battlerie
Description:
Card drafting game set in Marais poitevin, western France.

Each player chooses a boatman at the beginning of the game and between 8-11 cards are dealt to the players depending on the number of players (including boatmen cards and journy cards).

Each round the players choose 1 card and pass the other ones to his neighbour.

Players try to find the best combinations of journey vs boatmen in their boat, in order to maximize their final score.

Name: Opetellaan taitoja
Description: Learn different skills by doing fun and engaging tasks. If you succeed at the task you'll receive the card which can be used to purchase puzzle pieces - first one to complete their puzzle is the winner!

Name: Sjörövar-Pippi
Description: You have to collect pairs while making sure you don't have Sjörövar-Pippi (Pirate Pippi) on hand when the cards and the game are over.

Name: Tank Clash: Western Front
Description:
Immerse yourself in battle with 6 iconic World War 2 tanks!

Tank Clash is a casual warfare strategy game for 2 players that a noob or skilled player can enjoy. It features a checkers-style armour tracking system with dice rolling and hand management for tactical choices.

Take command of fearsome German tanks like the Panzer IV, Marder III and Tiger I. In the early stages of the war, Germany tank offensives in Poland and France proved that armour was essential for victory.

Although the Germans created very formidable tanks, the Americans managed to use innovative tactics and its industrial might to turn the tide of the war. They built the M4 Sherman, M18 Hellcat and M26 Pershing to counter them.


This tank skirmish game is designed to be easy-to-learn, quick to setup and played within an hour. Replayability is high as there are different secret missions, morale cards, modular terrain boards and tank commander abilities.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bolyai Értékadó Társasjáték
Description: There are number and formula cards. Players need to play such number cards to formula cards that the formula completes. The last player wins the rounds.

Name: Hyper Ball
Description:
Hyper Ball is a fast-paced, hard-hitting futuristic sports game. It is played with two teams of four power armoured athletes in a walled arena. Points are scored by throwing or kicking the ball into the opposing team’s goal.

Players alternately activate their team members and spend action points to manoeuvre them around the arena. Whenever a player wishes to throw the ball they must flick a disc at the relevant target on a separate dexterity board to determine if the throw was successful.

Every team member has a number of power points stored in their armour’s battery which can be spent on either; generating additional action points, re-flicking missed throws, knocking down opponents or activating special abilities. Depleted batteries can be recharged when the athletes use the “rest” action.

At the end of a pre/determined number of turns the team with the highest number of goals will be declared the victors.

-description from designer

Name: Bulánci: Speciální jednotky
Description:
Bulánci is the original Czech freeware game for Microsoft Windows from 2001, in which Bulánci - known as E.A.P. (extremely aggressive pillows) fight against each other. The game is 2D with an overhead view. It was created by the Czech company SleepTeam Labs.

In 2021 Bulánci 2.0 was announced commercially for PC/Mac/Linux and game console Playstation/Switch/Xbox. The port was funded on Czech crowdfunding site StartovaÄ. During the crowdfunding campaign, SleepTeam released a standalone card game Bulánci: Speciální jednotky.

The second pillow war is coming to a head. Soon it will become clear which pillow is the toughest.

In the game, you play the role of an officer tasked with assembling the best possible special unit of soldiers. Each unit has only 4 members in the form of cards lying in front of the player. The strongest unit wins the battle, but the war is not over yet. You need to build more and more units until you get 5 buttons and reach the rank of general...

In December 2022, Sleepteam released the free downloadable expansion Bulánci: Speciální jednotky – DÅ¯stojnický deník (Officer's Journal).

After the first edition was sold out, Velitelská edice (Commander's Edition) was released in August 2024, containing 3 new expansions, including DÅ¯stojnický deník.

Name: Orphan Annie to the Rescue
Description:
Orphan Annie to the rescue is a Spin-and-Move game for 2 to 4 players.

Each player takes a counter for his Orphan Annie. High Spin plays first. Spin dial in turn moving that number of spaces from the start.

Some of the spaces are marked with indicators that vary the moves.  When a counter lands on:

+  'A' -- advance 2 spaces

+ 'T' -- lose one turn

+  'x' -- proceed to a large 'X'

+ 'B' -- move back 5 spaces

and so on. Landing on a red space around the lake allows the player to attempt to rescue Sandy, who has broken through the ice, and by being the first to do so they win the game.

Name: Unlucky Adventurers
Description:
Unlucky Adventurers is a family-friendly card & dice game, where the aim of the game is to eliminate your opponents, while keeping as many cards as possible.

For 2-6 players, play against each other or in teams, using both strategy and luck to outwit your fellow players and earn yourself the lofty title of "Reasonably Lucky Adventurer".

From perplexing potions to awesome actions and everything in between, you'll find 126 cards in total across 3 decks to try your luck with on your adventures.

With over 90 unique cards, each with their own subtle (or sometimes blatant) nods to your favourite fantasy films, table-top games, pop-culture references and more, there is something for everyone to enjoy.

No fantasy adventure would be complete without the chance to encounter a whole host of weird and wonderful creatures, and Unlucky Adventurers is no different.

With 12 unique monsters to face off against, will you be able to fend them off and keep your loot?

Each player starts with 1 character card and 7 cards from the Quest Deck. Each turn you draw 1 card from the Quest Deck and play 1 card from your hand.

The aim is simple. Try to eliminate your opponent while keeping as many cards for yourself, but watch out for blunders and beast encounters!

—description from the designer

Name: Second Fallujah
Description:
This two-player (solitaire adaptable) grand-tactical design covers the fighting from the start of the main Coalition assault on 8 November 2004 through 14 November, when most of the city had been secured.

—description from the publisher

Name: Clandestine
Description:
For those who dare venture into the shadows of darkened alleys, one can hear the whispers and plotting as the seeds of the future's most powerful secret societies take root.  Discovery of mysterious, ancient and even enchanted relics have aspiring groups experimenting with strange energy and manipulating the public to further their research into the unknown.  Each society takes a different path to uncover impactful secrets while maximizing the intrigue it generates with its actions.

This thematic, strategy game leverages mancalas within interconnecting rondels allowing players to conduct actions in a shared space while planning ahead for unique actions within their own societies.

Play secrets, activate a public or society leader, and conduct clandestine actions on your turn to discover relics, research secrets, cleanse your society of chaos, or more in this deep strategy game with quick turns.

The game ends when a player upgrades their Society to the max level (5). The winner is the player whose Society has generated the most Intrigue (victory points).

Will you generate the most intriguing secret society or will your society's efforts be lost to the ages?

—description from the designer

Name: Pictionary Family
Description:
Pictionary Family is a modified version of the original game, designed for play with both adults and children together. Players divide into two teams, preferably with children divided equally among the two or four teams. Each turn there is one Picturist and the rest of the team players as Guessers.

The game consists of rolling a die to circle a linear track on the board. Topics to draw come from cards. An hourglass marks the time limit for guessing. The cards contain family friendly topics, suitable for both children and adults. Guessing correctly earns the next roll. The game is advertised for Ages 8 and up.
Families: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

Name: Dante: Gioca con i Dannati
Description:
50 cards and lots of games with the characters of Dante's Inferno! A unique deck of cards and a booklet with instructions, to play with Dante's Inferno and discover some of Dante's most famous characters: from Paolo and Francesca to Conte Ugolino, from Gianni Schicchi to Bonifacio VIII, passing through Attila, Ulysses and Lucifer himself. Each of the 50 cards represents a famous inhabitant of Hell, from the famous, such as Fra 'Dolcino, to the most unknown, such as Filippo Argenti.
Each card displays several information and category scoring points and can be used to play at least 12 different games.
In "Scontro fra Dannati" (Clash of the Damned) the first player chooses a card from his deck, chooses a category (fame, evilness, retaliation) and announce the points of his character's category; the player with the highest value wins the hand. When a player runs out of cards he's out.
The player collecting all the characters wins.
In the cooperative game "Dannati con Ordine" (Damned in Order), players start with 5 cards each and they must end all cards they have, putting them down on a growing order, two cards each turn, over five different decks representing the categories .
Players win if they manage to discard all their cards.
In "Quante Storie" (So Many Stories) each players pick a card and start telling a story and other player will follow and try to continue and finally end the story.
Other games that can be played with the cards are Guess this Card, Down to Hell, Dante's Map.

Name: Ubrique
Description:
It is the early 20th century. Top international brands are flocking to Ubrique in search of skilled artisans to craft their most luxurious wallets and handbags. You run a small workshop with your family, hoping to become one of Ubrique's top manufacturers.

Players will begin with single family-owned workshop. They will then begin taking orders from European brands, requesting a set of either wallets or handbags. In order to complete these orders, players will have to purchase the right amount of leather skins, and outsource as many workshops as needed.

During the course of the game, players will also encounter opportunities to upgrade their production, whether it's improving revenue from specific cities, requiring less skins for certain products, or simply by acquiring new workshops.

The game ends when a player buys a target amount of workshops (this could be from 2 to 5, depends on the total players and the desired game length).

The game features beautiful thematic art, and uses exclusively cards in different sizes and formats. It's easy to learn, and apt for beginners and veterans alike, putting their time and economical management skills to the test.

It is a portable, short, fast-paced game that simulates Ubrique's leather goods production history, as it begun with modest individually-owned workshops, and grew to a town with major factories that work closely with top European brands.

The game also used insider expertise and consultancy from the designer's father, Inaki Xalabarde, who is a leather goods fashion designer himself, and has lived and worked in Ubrique sporadically.

-description from designer

Name: Woddle
Description:
Seven letter cards and the box as a target!
Combine luck and strategy in this card game for the whole family.
Be infinitely creative with letters to win.

Turn over a theme card.
Can you think of a word that fits the theme?
Then throw the correct letter card on the box.
The challenge gets even bigger with the different Woddle Modes.

Who knows, you might be the Woddle winner?

Name: Dice Forge: Piranha Princesse
Description:
New promotional card offered to the winners of a tournament organized at the "Festival Ludique International de Parthenay" (FLIP).

This card was created to honor Piranha, the winner of the 2021 French Dice forge championship.

RULES :

When you buy this card, you gain as many victory points as the number of completed rounds multiplied by 2. AND THEN you can make a normal forge (with any number of faces) with the gold you have + a bonus of the number of remaining rounds in gold, multiplied by 2.

So : 
Win 2 X (past rounds) victory points
AND
Forge with a bonus of 2 X (remaining rounds) golds

Name: The Gilded Carcanet
Description:
"An ancient treasure has been said to be buried on a small island outside the coast of Turkey. Little is known about it and its existence has been heavily debated in the archeology community. Professor in archeology, Bartholomew Wilson, has always dismissed the idea as a myth. Until now.

Armed only with a mysterious letter and a cheap souvenir from his old friend Edward, Bartholomew and Oscar set out on an epic adventure. Even though they find a very helpful item along the way, adventuring is not easy and their path turns out to be full of challenges to overcome.

The Gilded Carcanet puts you in the shoes of Bartholomew as you try to piece together the answers to the many mysteries of the Aegean Sea. In each chapter, you will face a challenge to solve for our duo to continue their quest."

Prof. Barty and Oscar Quin are waiting for you to join them on their lifetime adventure. Logic puzzles, assembly, folding, decoding, brainstorming, and a lot of fun are ahead of you. If you want to put your IQ to the test, don’t hesitate to try it out.

We’ve got your back with well-balanced hints for each challenge and a walkthrough explanation to make sure the game will run smoothly even if you get stuck.

Name: Moji Challenge: Animals
Description:
Moji Challenge: Animals involves 165 challenges (3 difficulty levels) across 55 cards to get all your parties going. Play in pairs or in teams, choosing from a huge range of game varieties. Find out what sort of animal lurks inside you: Are you a tiger or a pussy cat?

The rules are simple. Each challenge completed successfully wins you fame points. The first player or team to score 15 fame points wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ultimate Showdown
Description:
The game that pits famous people and characters in a battle to decide once and for all -- Who can triumph under the description at hand? Will it be the Easter Bunny vs. Ben Franklin for Best Babysitter? Or will Genghis Khan beat out Frank Sinatra for Best Roadtrip Companion? Anything goes! You pick the challenges and YOU try to get your picks to WIN!

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Pirates
Description:
Pirates is a next expansion to Neuroshima Hex 3.0, the iconic area control game about the world of Neuroshima.

A pirate flag fluttered over the Caribbean islands where King Contamination and Queen Neo-Jungle would rule. The gangsters of the seas have a few surprises for their enemies... The new army plays by unprecedented rules, extending the standard Battlefield with special Water Spaces, to which only Pirates have access. The large quality of battle tiles allows them to control the pace of the game, which is crucial when planning in the headquarters location throughout the game. Pirates weakness is the low Initiative and lack of Toughness, as well as the negligible Mobility of non-floating units.

Remember that the Pirate Army cannot be used when playing with the Expanded Battlefield rules (5 and 6 player games, or expanded 4 player games).

-description from publisher

Name: More Leaders (fan expansion for 7 Wonders)
Description:
More Leaders is a fan-made Print&Play add-on for 7 Wonders (2nd Edition).
This add-on gives you about 50 new Leaders from the Antiquity for the expansion Leaders.
In this add-on you will find Leaders with already known and brand new effects, for the Base Game, Cities, Armada and Edifice expansion. Some Leaders are also for the upcoming remake/update of previous fan-made expansion Sailors.

This project is non-profit and it is strictly forbidden to profit of any kind based on this work.
Credits go to 7 Wonders original designer/artist/publisher.
Credits for the arts used are inside the rules.

—description from the designer

Name: Race For The Title
Description:
Race For The Title is a deckbuilding football card game for 1-4 players. Every player starts with a weak hand of cards which they attempt to improve upon every round as they accumulate money and play matches against their opponents.

You will look to strengthen your team so to be more successful in matches, but you'll also need to grow your club's finances so you can buy new players. It's a tricky balancing act to achieve and it might be the case that smart decisions only start paying off as the game goes into the late stages.

There are five kinds of cards in the game:

- player cards feature players and you'll use them in matches against an opponent 
- formation cards give your playing skills a permanent boost. Keep them on display at all times
- stadium cards increase the money you make when you play a home match
- action cards allow you to weaken an opponent's team or, in some cases, gain extra cards for free
- economy cards give you income you can spend in the Marketplace

You'll only ever have five cards (six/seven if you happen to have a formation/stadium card in play) in play at one time. Your active hand is known as your Line-Up.

To play matches, pick an opponent. Add up your total attacking scores across your Line-Up. Your opponent does the same but adds up their total defence score. Then both managers add a dice roll to your score. Highest combined score wins the match!

The winning team takes three points and moves up the league table. The first team to reach 70 points wins the title!

Race For The Title is the second game by Webstar Games - the first, Counter Attack, is also football themed.

Note: Race For the Title didn't meet its Kickstarter goal in 2022. It has since been redesigned (which is why you'll find two different looks to the game) and is ready for a Kickstarter relaunch soon

-description from designer

Name: Backyard Chickens: Solo Expansion
Description:
A sneaky fox has her sights set on your chicken coop! You must score ten or more points before the fox breaks into your coop to steal your eggs. These rules allow you to play Backyard Chickens by yourself.

Contains 15 cards, a small four page rule book, and one token.  for playing the solo game. Available as a free print-and-play add-on or through The Game Crafter.

Name: Unsurmountable: Acclimatization
Description:
Higher altitudes means lower oxygen. Make camp periodically to acclimatize or you’ll be too sick to complete the climb.

This 6-card expansion introduces Camp cards. Two of these are dealt at the start of every game and both of these camps must be reached sequentially before the summit. Making camp requires aligning two specific features horizontally adjacent. Players with the Big Climb expansion can even combine it with Acclimitization, drawing three camps instead for a massive multi-stage hike.

Name: Unsurmountable: Rescue Mission
Description:
Danger strikes all too often on the mountain. When you get a distress call from a trapped climber, you don’t hesitate to help!

This 3-card expansion adds Rescue cards. One of these is placed midway through the Mountain deck at start to mark the stranded climber. Rescue cards work like Mountain cards, but cannot be discarded for an action and must be included in a successful path up the mountain.

Name: Skulls of Sedlec: Ultimate Champions
Description:
Ultimate Champions is a 1-card additional champion for Skulls of Sedlec, complementing those from Skulls of Sedlec: Champions.

Ultimate Champions want to be next to other Champions.

Name: Puerto Rico 1897
Description:
Puerto Rico 1897 takes place the year after Puerto Rico achieved political autonomy and separated itself from the colonial Spanish government. In the game, you take on the role of an independent Puerto Rican farmer in this new era and compete against others to hire workers to grow, sell, and trade valuable crops. You will also be in charge of resurrecting parts of the country as you attempt to build vital city infrastructure. Your goal throughout the game is to acquire more wealth and prestige than your opponents and become the most prosperous farmer across the country. Each player has their own small board with spaces for city buildings, plantations, and resources. Shared between the players are three ships, a trading house, and a supply of resources and doubloons.

Puerto Rico 1897 uses a variable phase order mechanism in which a token is passed clockwise to the next player at the conclusion of a turn. The player with the token begins the round by choosing a role and taking the first action.The resource cycle of the game is that players grow crops that they exchange for points or doubloons. Doubloons can then be used to buy buildings, which allow players to produce more crops or give them other abilities. Buildings and plantations do not function unless they are staffed by workers.

During each round, players take turns selecting a role card from those on the table (such as "Trader" or "Builder"). When a role is chosen, every player gets to take the action associated with that role. The player who selected the role also receives a small privilege for doing so; for example, choosing the "Builder" role allows all players to construct a building, but the player who chose the role may do so at a discount on that turn. Unused roles gain a doubloon bonus at the end of each turn, and the next player who chooses that role gets to keep any doubloon bonus associated with it. This encourages players to make use of all the roles throughout a typical course of a game.

Players earn victory points for owning buildings, for shipping goods, and for occupied "large buildings". Each player's accumulated shipping chips are kept face down and come in denominations of one or five. This prevents other players from being able to determine the exact score of another player. Goods and doubloons are placed in clear view of other players, and the totals of each can always be requested by a player. As the game enters its later stages, the unknown quantity of shipping tokens and its denominations require players to consider their options before choosing a role that can end the game.

Puerto Rico 1897 includes four expansions.
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos
Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: バラバランス (Balabalance)
Description:
Balabalance is a dexterity game where players must balance a stack of wooden components in one hand while continuing to play the game with their other hand.

The game uses a dice similar to that in the game LCR which determines where a piece should be placed: the hand of the player to your left, the player to you right, or the middle.

The first player who is not able to maintain the balance of their stack loses.

Name: Black Seas: Hold Fast! Supplement
Description:
Black Seas focuses on the golden age of sail, which encompasses the period between 1770 and 1830. During this period the navies of Europe and beyond fight for dominance of the high seas. Hold Fast! is a supplement for the Black Seas age of sail game. Inside, find new ways to play, such as charting your course as an independent smuggler or following a navy career from lieutenant to admiral.

Fight in 16 new scenarios that range between cat-and-mouse chases, shallow river battles, passenger escorts, and mutinies. All culminating the explosive Battle of the Nile which saw the spectacular demise of the French Flagship L'Orient.

Launch new famous ships, such as HMS Agamemnon, Santa Ana, or USS Niagara. Commission new captains of renown for the British, French, Spanish, and US navies, such as Louis-Antoine-Cyprien Infernet or John Paul Jones. Or set sail with entirely new fleets from the Russian, Swedish, Dutch, Portuguese, or Ottoman Empire navies. Alternatively become the scourge of the Mediterranean at the head of a Barbary Cost pirate fleet.

Finally, alongside all the new additional advanced rules and ship statistics, enjoy three solo scenarios or introduce the nightmare terrors of the deep that are born from sailors' superstitions.

Name: Professor Swen's Lab
Description:
An evil scientist, who hates winter and snow, invents a device that is destroying all the snow in your city.

You find his lost, top-secret diary, which might lead to his lab. Now you have a chance to turn off this machine and bring back the magic of winter.

Are you brave enough to break into his lab and figure out how to stop this madness?

You have 1 hour before the evil scientist returns to the lab. Better hurry up — he can be very hostile!

Name: Troll Tanks
Description:
Troll Tanks is a fast, fun and simple, yet strategic 2-player turn based tabletop game with some cardboard craft chucked in for good measure. The aim of the game is for each player to expand their territory to obtain new tanks, battle enemy tanks and ultimately capture the enemy base.

The game is played with a deck of 54 square terrain cards and 10 tanks, and oh yeah the tanks are made out of toilet rolls.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Championship Immortal
Description:
Championship Immortal is a last-man-standing, tactical, and strategic fantasy themed board game for 2-6 players.

Held only once every thousand years, the greatest warriors in all the realms compete to obtain the title of CHAMPION IMMORTAL.

Play as one of six unique character classes, each with thier own deck. Play cards to move around the board, attack, and use other abilities. Collect item powerful item cards, outmaneuver your opponents, and use tactical advantages of the board to defeat the other players. And with a fully modular board, every play of the game is different.

—description from the publisher

Name: Martini
Description:
Martini is a trick-taking domino game for two to four players.

Players may play a domino from their hand, or choose a face up domino from their martini glass. As they drink their martini (play from their strawman), more dominoes are revealed.

The strength row displays the suits from strongest to weakest. The domino of the highest strength wins the trick, and the player collects their point tile.

The person who played the weakest domino may choose to Shake (shuffle and deal out the strength line) or Stir (move the winning suit to the lowest strength).

The winner of a trick leads to the next trick. The hand continues until all points tiles have been claimed.

Name: Toll House
Description:
What Is This?
Toll House is a Tabletop experience where players engage in Semi-Competitive Resource-Management & Semi-Cooperative Combat. The Afterlife Theme, depicted in an Iconographic Byzantine Style, is based on an Ancient Christian Narrative. The Game Features "No Words", "Simple Rules", yet "Complex Choices".

What Is The Goal?
If the Soul Ascends to the Top of the Ladder, Immediately All Guardians Win.
If the Monster Ascends to the Top of the Ladder, Immediately All Monsters Win.

How Does The Game Start?
All Players Receive a Secret Role: Guardian Or Monster. Each Player Receives A Starting Hero With a Specific Advantage. The Heroes and Ascension Cards are Revealed In The Field. The Player Whose Color Is Least Represented In The Field Will Start First.

How Does The Game Work?
On a turn, a player will take ONE Action, and then Reveal a Soul Card.

Actions:
 1) Take Tokens
 2) Acquire a Hero
 3) Purchase An Ascension Card
 4) Combat Monsters

Soul Cards:
 1) Monsters - Players Can Defeat Monsters Using Shields
 2) Ladders - Players Can Move Forward One Step For Each Ladder Card They Take
 3) Candle - Monster Character Moves Up One Space For Each Undefeated Monster Card (Ladders Are Not Monster Cards)

Name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #1
Description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #1 was published in October 1994.

Table of contents:

Features

Scenario: Beta Convoy
ACSC Reading list
History of Italian Carriers
Planning Strike Packages
WWII Tactical Comms
Command at Sea Logs
Alerts
Book Reviews
Product Updates
Platform Specifications:
French La Fayette class
Russian MIG31M Foxhound B
Italian Aquila CV
Italian Re 2001
Families: Magazine: The Naval SITREP – Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming

Name: Cubitos: Dodatkowe trasy
Description: Two additional promo tracks to Cubitos.

Name: Toinc
Description:
Come and meet Toinc, a super card game that will take you inside the American football field.

The objective of Toinc, as in the game of American Football, is to conquer territory as an attacking team and reach the opposing Endzone to make Touchdowns. And, of course, the defending team will try to stop this with all the vigor of their defensive line. And if they regain possession of the ball, they become the new attacking team.

Toinc is a card game for two players, where it brings the magic of American Football with all its elements and moves, but without being complicated. Build your attacking hand with explosive plays, but don't forget to leave someone to defend your Quarterback from the opposing team's players. The strategy in the assembly of your hand is fundamental to attack and defend successfully, conquering more points than your opponent.

—description from the publisher

Name: Flying Frog Roll-to-Move 2022 Goody Box
Description: A box of goodies for the Roll-to-Move 2022 virtual convention. All content was for Shadows of Brimstone.

Name: Remote Viewing
Description:
In Remote Viewing, players are testing their clairvoyant abilities in describing the possible location of criminals to FBI agents.

The game includes a large map and 4 levels of clues.  Each clue card represents a different location in the map, but depending upon the difficulty chosen, the image may be more obscured. The player taking on the role of the clairvoyant in a turn chooses a difficulty of card and attempts to describe a location to the FBI agents.

The FBI agents each get one guess for the location and once they choose a location, they cannot move it and a second player cannot guess the same space.  The clairvoyant has a limited amount of time to describe the scene, and if an agent can guess the location in that time, both the agent and the clairvoyant gets points.  If an agent guesses after the description time, only the agent gets points.  If no agent guesses the correct location, the clairvoyant loses points.

The game ends when a player reaches 9 points and that player wins.

The game is based upon one of the designer's works from the "Is this a game?" exhibit, and includes a two-player cooperative version which most closely resembles the exhibition version.

Name: Wikoti
Description:
In the memory game Wikoti, children from 5 years old help the Sioux to reach their teepee before the end of the night. Cooperation, memory, and cleverness will be their best allies to win! A game that grows with the children, with rule levels for all ages. The game contains information on how the Sioux lived.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wooka Booka Island
Description:
A mysterious door appeared in your room out of nowhere! As you walk through it, suddenly you find yourself on the wondrous island of Wooka Booka. There are four animal kingdoms and only one treasure chest. You have a chance to find this long-lost treasure, but first you need to pass the challenges of every kingdom.

A escape room kit for kids.  Focused on puzzles, cooperation, and creativity.
A role of game master is used:
"1. Setting up the game, and
2. Playing the role of Lau Kamau – the friendly giant guardian.

This role will allow you to guide the kids, monitor their progress, and help them if necessary. And because we made a special guide for you, your job will be a piece of cake!"

Name: QTDEN: The game where you have to fill in the gaps
Description:
QTDEN is the game where you have to choose the funniest combinations.

Twelve answer cards are given to each player and one of them reads the question card. This card has a gap and the players will have to choose from their answers which one can be the funniest.

The player who wins 5 rounds is proclaimed the winner.

Name: A game about selecting seven cards, speedily searching for synergies.
Description:
A realtime drafting games, featuring cards that feature a mixture of pictures (sometimes incorporating icons you are searching for), a 'type' (that might matter for other cards) and usually some text that gives you bonus points for collecting icons or types of cards.

The haberdasher wants partyhats. The band leader needs music. The party planner has a list of things to gather. The hermit forces you to get rid of all the other creatures, but at least you get some points automatically.

Everyone takes their time choosing their initial card, then after a countdown you start speedily searching for synergies!

The rush might only last a couple of minutes!

By the end you'll have your seven cards. But if you weren't fast enough, you'll have to take random cards to finish your seven. And that might hurt you!

—description from the designer

Name: The Hill of Death: Champion Hill
Description:
The Hill of Death is the first game in the new "Shattered Union" American Civil War series by Tiny Battle Publishing. The series is designed to be accessible and fast-playing, suitable for gamers of any experience level. It is based firmly within the core design philosophy of the Blind Swords and Black Swan systems, but will focus on more obscure or over-looked battles and campaigns, including some fictional "what if" battles that could have occurred during the war. The entire series is governed by one relatively simple set of standard Series Rules, which are altered in each game by a few Game Module specific rules.

The Hill of Death is the first Game Module in the Shattered Union series and covers the entire Battle of Champion Hill. This critical engagement was fought just outside of Vicksburg, Mississippi on May 16th ,1863, between the Union Army of the Tennessee (under Major General Ulysses S. Grant) and the Confederate Army of Vicksburg (under Lieutenant General John C. Pemberton). Grant successfully landed his Union army on the shores of the Mississippi River and quickly advanced inland towards the Mississippi state capital of Jackson. General Joseph E. Johnston’s Confederate force made only a token effort at defending the city and then Johnston instructed Pemberton to sally forth from the Vicksburg fortress and attack Grant’s line of supply. On the morning of May 16th, Pemberton’s Army of Vicksburg was in route to fulfilling that mission when it received new orders from Johnston to turn around and join him near the town of Clinton. Pemberton hesitated and as he contemplated his next move, Grant about-faced the Union army. Leaving most of Sherman’s Corps to hold Jackson, he began a determined advance against Vicksburg and Pemberton’s strung out and confused Rebel army. The Battle of Champion Hill was underway, and the fate of Vicksburg hung in the balance. 
   
—description from designer

Components:

1 – 17" x 22" Map 
189 – Counters 
45 – Cards
1 – Player Aid
1 – Series Rulebook
1 – Game Module Rulebook
5 – Six-Sided Dice (Red, White, Black, Blue and Gray)

Name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – The Infinity Saga
Description:
The Infinity Saga from the Marvel Cinematic Universe reaches its climax in the world of Legendary.

The 31st Expansion to the vast Legendary Landscape.

Add to your collection with new Heroes, Masterminds, Villain groups and Schemes.

Powerful Marvel favorites join the fight against Thanos and the Black Order.

New cards will feature images which capture the epic scope of the popular Infinity Saga films.

Requires a Marvel Legendary Core Set to play. This expansion is an ideal companion to the Legendary: Marvel Studios' Phase 1 Base Set and the Spider-Man: Homecoming and Marvel Studios' Guardians of the Galaxy expansions.

-description from publisher

Name: Food Market
Description:
"The freshest game on the market!"

Food Market is the game where you will need to fill your shopping basket in a healthy way with the available products on the market (Proteins, Hydrates, Fruits-Vegetables and Drinks).

Use the Events to enhance your shopping foods and get rid of the trash food, that your opponents will try to put in your cart.

In Food Market, the first person who reaches 10 points with at least one food of each category wins the game.

—description from the designer

"¡El juego más fresco del mercado!"

«Food Market» es un juego en el que tendrás que llenar tu cesta de la compra de una manera saludable con lo alimentos disponibles en el mercado (Proteínas, Hidratos, Frutas-Verduras y Bebidas).

Utiliza los eventos para mejorar los alimentos de tu compra y deshacerte de la comida basura que te colocaran el resto de jugadores.

En «Food Market» gana el primer jugador que consiga llegar a 10 puntos, teniendo al menos 1 alimento de cada categoría.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

Name: burncycle: Ebbwall Expansion
Description:
This expansion adds a new Corporation to fight against and a powerful CEO. Ebbwall is one of the key corporations responsible for bot subjugation. With their premiere training facilities, this private defense contractor ships highly-trained guards to other corporations around the world.

This expansion adds 3 new neoprene rooms, 1 thread card, 8 mission cards, 1 CEO chip, 2 captain cards with 2 captain chips, 6 guard chips, 3 equipment cards, 2 equipment dice, 2 mod cards, 1 floorplan booklet, 1 reference card.

Name: Cube-Tac-Toe
Description:
Cube-Tac-Toe is a game of strategy. Two players build a CUBE, made up of 27 small cubes, from the ground up, competing for Cube-Tac-Toe points as they build. Three in a row is a Cube-Tac-Toe point. The player with the most Cube-Tac-Toe points is the winner.

—description from the instruction sheet

Published in the early 1980s by Rhombics, a maker of wooden puzzles, the pieces are made out of light Maple and dark Walnut.
